item.title: Software: Vivarium
item.author: Corentin
item.description: I am currently working on a project named Vivarium that serves both research and teaching in AI. It’s a software that allows launching custom particle based multi-agents simulations, using a physics engine built in Jax. The simulations can be hosted on a server, and interacted with in real time from a web interface or Jupyter Notebooks. The Notebook case aims to teach students how to program behaviors of simulated robots with Python !

item.title: Software: Simulation Sandbox
item.author: Corentin
item.description: SimulationSandbox is a simple framework built with Jax and Socket that allows for real-time interaction between a simulation hosted on a server and multiple clients. It provides a simple interface for visualizing or interacting with the state of a hosted simulation from remote clients, such as jupyter notebooks. Code
